title: Quick Chinese-Style Vermicelli (Rice Noodles) Recipe
description: Rice vermicelli are quick-cooking rice noodles. In this recipe, they get jazzed up with a spicy soy sauce glaze for a quick and delicious side dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Quick Chinese-Style Vermicelli (Rice Noodles) 4.1 (150) 116 Reviews 27 Photos These Chinese-style rice vermicelli noodles make a quick and delicious meal. Submitted by Serena Liew Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 27 27 27 27 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (8 ounce) package dried rice noodles 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 clove garlic, minced 1 tablespoon soy sauce ½ tablespoon chili sauce salt and pepper to taste 1 green onion, chopped Directions Fill a large pot with water and bring to a rolling boil; stir in rice noodles and return to a boil. Cook until al dente, 2 to 3 minutes; try not to overcook as they will become mushy. Drain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until tender. Stir in noodles; season with soy sauce, chili sauce, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle with chopped green onion. I Made It Print 215 home cooks made it! I used sesame chili oil instead of vegetable oil and also added shredded cabbage & carrots, bean sprouts and green onion!! 06 of 27 Photo by  charmaine10 09/08/2018 07 of 27 Photo by  jrj27 06/30/2018 Love this- quick and tasty, vegan and cheap to make 08 of 27 Photo by  Pryce Agurs 05/30/2018 Easy peasy & Delicious . Quick and simple! I mixed white onion as well as some granulated garlic. Thanks for the great recipe. 09 of 27 Photo by  Pryce Agurs 05/30/2018 Easy peasy & Delicious . Quick and simple! I mixed white onion as well as some granulated garlic. Thanks for the great recipe. 10 of 27 Photo by  Christina Reynolds 09/20/2016 super duper easy! name: Serena Liew
instructions: Fill a large pot with water and bring to a rolling boil; stir in rice noodles and return to a boil. Cook until al dente, 2 to 3 minutes; try not to overcook as they will become mushy. Drain.;Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until tender. Stir in noodles; season with soy sauce, chili sauce, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle with chopped green onion.
